title: Electric flux - compare square and right triangle

content.prompt: A square and a 45-degree right triangle both lie in the xy plane in an xyz coordinate system, as shown in the figure. The lengths of the square’s sides and the triangle’s two legs are both equal to d. There are different uniform electric fields in the regions containing the square and the triangle. For the square, the electric field is Esquare=2E0i^+E0k^, and for the triangle the electric field is Etriangle=E0i^+2E0k^. Which of the following statements has a correct claim comparing the electric flux magnitude through each area and also provides evidence or reasoning that helps support the claim?

choices.label: The flux magnitude is the same for both shapes. The square and the triangle have the same field magnitude.
The flux magnitude is the same for both shapes. Compared to the square, the triangle has half the area and a field with twice the z-component.
The flux magnitude is greater for the square than for the triangle. Compared to the triangle, the square has twice the area and the same field magnitude.
The flux magnitude is greater for the square than for the triangle. Both the area and the field component parallel to the plane of the shape is greater for the square.

skill.text: 3.C: Justify or support a claim using evidence from experimental data, physical representations, or physical principles or laws.
